content:
• Wednesday, May 8, 2013
  • TM

    Japanese stocks extend their run today, after U.S. markets finished at record highs. The Nikkei...

    Japanese stocks extend their run today, after U.S. markets finished at record highs. The Nikkei Average is currently trading at 14,354 after ending Wednesday at its highest level since June 2008: Toyota (TM +1.7%), Fanuc (OTCPK:FANUY +2.2%), Casio (OTCPK:CSIOY +2.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 PM
  • OSUR

    More OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR): Q1 EPS loss comes in line with estimates, but revenue...

    More OraSure Technologies (NASDAQ:OSUR): Q1 EPS loss comes in line with estimates, but revenue beat consensus on a slight increase in sales Y/Y. For Q2, the company expects to report a loss of $0.16 - $0.15 per share on revenues of $22.5M - $24M, slightly worse than the Street EPS view of a loss of $0.14. but at the high end of revenue projections of $23.29M. Shares +1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 PM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA) +6.1% AH in response to Green Mountain's FQ2 beat and FY13...

    Coffee Holding Co. (NASDAQ:JVA) +6.1% AH in response to Green Mountain's FQ2 beat and FY13 guidance hike. This is far from the first time JVA has moved sharply in response to a Green Mountain earnings report.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM | 6 Comments
  • MM

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Millennial Media (MM - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $58M-$60M,...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Millennial Media (MM - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $58M-$60M, below a consensus of $60.8M. Expects 2013 revenue of $270M-$280M vs. a $275.3M consensus. 2) Spreadtrum (SPRD - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $220M-$228M, above a $205M consensus. 3) sTec (STEC - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $23M-$26M and EPS of -$0.41 to -$0.43 vs. a consensus of $25.2M and -$0.39. MM -2.7% AH. SPRD +2.7%. STEC unchanged. (Millennial PR) (Spreadtrum PR) (sTec PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM
  • CLR

    More on Continental Resources' (NYSE:CLR) Q1 results: The largest leaseholder in the Bakken...

    More on Continental Resources' (NYSE:CLR) Q1 results: The largest leaseholder in the Bakken shale, CLR has reported higher quarterly revenue for three years. Average production rose 42% to a record ~121.5K boe/day; 71% is crude oil. Oil production rose 44% though prices fell 0.7%, natural gas rose 38% while prices were up 11%, crude oil equivalents rose 40% and prices added 1.3%. Shares -1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • TSLA

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: TSLA +17%. GMCR +12%. GRPN +10%. EOX +6%. EXAM +6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: TSLA +17%. GMCR +12%. GRPN +10%. EOX +6%. EXAM +6%.
    After-hours top losers: RAX -17%. OME -14%. LPSN -13%. MNST -12%. OFIX -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) +1% AH after Clifton Robbins gives the company a favorable mention at the...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) +1% AH after Clifton Robbins gives the company a favorable mention at the Sohn Investment Conference. Meanwhile, Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) -2.2% AH in response to Rackspace's revenue miss and soft hosting services data. A Bloomberg column earlier today discussed Akamai's growing security service ambitions. Though security made up less than 2% of Akamai's 2012 sales, the company has big hopes for a recently-launched service called Kona Site Defender that leverages Akamai's giant content delivery network to stop DDoS and other hacking attacks
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI): Q1 EPS of -$0.71. Revenue of $28.3M misses by $3.57M. Shares -8.7% AH.

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI): Q1 EPS of -$0.71. Revenue of $28.3M misses by $3.57M. Shares -8.7% AH.

  • DCTH

    More on Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH): Q1 comes up short on a per share basis but beats on the...

    More on Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH): Q1 comes up short on a per share basis but beats on the revenue side. Most of the revenue gain was related to the recognition of previously deferred revenue as a result of satisfying certain requirements of the its Research and Distribution agreement with Chi-Fu Trading in Taiwan, while the remainder was from product sales. SG&A and R&D expenses both declined, primarily due to a significant reduction in expenses related to the its New Drug Application submission to the FDA. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM

    Delcath (OTC:DCTH): Q1 EPS loss of -$0.15 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $400K (+42% Y/Y) beats by...

    Delcath (OTC:DCTH): Q1 EPS loss of -$0.15 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $400K (+42% Y/Y) beats by $120K. (PR). Shares -4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM

    Providence Service (NASDAQ:PRSC): Q1 EPS of $0.49. Revenue of $281.5M (+8% Y/Y) misses by...

    Providence Service (NASDAQ:PRSC): Q1 EPS of $0.49. Revenue of $281.5M (+8% Y/Y) misses by $0.98M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)

  • RAX

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) now -15.8% AH following its Q1 revenue miss. Server count rose 4% Q/Q to...

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) now -15.8% AH following its Q1 revenue miss. Server count rose 4% Q/Q to 95.1K, but average revenue/server fell $2 to $1,308 after steadily rising in 2012. Also, the net upgrade rate fell to 0.9% from Q4's 1.2% and Q3's 1.6%, and installed base growth fell to just 0.1% from Q4's 0.5% and Q3's 0.8%. Dedicated cloud (hosting) revenue +15% Y/Y (+18% in Q4) to $271.3M and still 75% of total. Public cloud (OpenStack) +40% (+49% in Q4) to $90.9M - investors might be looking for faster growth, given Amazon and Microsoft's growth rates. Capex was $125.4M (35% of revenue), +43% Q/Q and +52% Y/Y. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 1 Comment

    Inter Parfums (NASDAQ:IPAR): Q1 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.4. Revenue of $213.81M (+29.3% Y/Y)...

    Inter Parfums (NASDAQ:IPAR): Q1 EPS of $1.03 beats by $0.4. Revenue of $213.81M (+29.3% Y/Y) misses by $0.04M. Shares +5.6% AH. (PR)

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) rise 10.9% AH after coming off of a...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) rise 10.9% AH after coming off of a trading halt. A cozy 5-year deal with Starbucks and a FQ2 profit beat is more than enough to bring in buyers.

  • SSTK

    Shutterstock (NYSE:SSTK): Q1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $51.1M (+36% Y/Y) beats by...

    Shutterstock (NYSE:SSTK): Q1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $51.1M (+36% Y/Y) beats by $0.8M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)

  • TSLA

    More on Tesla Motors' (NASDAQ:TSLA) Q1: The company says it produced over 5K Model S vehicles...

    More on Tesla Motors' (NASDAQ:TSLA) Q1: The company says it produced over 5K Model S vehicles during the period to beat its early production estimate. As production rose, efficiencies kicked in and helped gross margin double Q/Q to 17%. In Q2, Tesla sees delivering just over 4.5K vehicles in North America and thinks it will beat its full year 20K vehicle delivery estimate. The next quarter will also see a moderate pickup in operational expenses and R&D expenses. TSLA +15.2% AH. (shareholder letter .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 19 Comments

    Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA): Q1 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $562M (+16% Y/Y) beats by...

    Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA): Q1 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $562M (+16% Y/Y) beats by $63M. Conference call scheduled for 5:30 PM EST. Shares +8.1% AH to $60.33. (PR)

  • CLNE

    More on Clean Energy (NASDAQ:CLNE): Q1 beats on a per shares basis as total sales increase by...

    More on Clean Energy (NASDAQ:CLNE): Q1 beats on a per shares basis as total sales increase by 13% Y/Y. Gallons delivered totaled 49.9M gallons, up 14% from 43.7M gallons delivered in the same period a year ago. Net earnings swung to a loss however, as bottom line margins were hit by an accounting charge related to how it values its Series I warrants. Shares +2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 1 Comment

    Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $804M (+37% Y/Y)...

    Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q1 EPS of $0.17 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $804M (+37% Y/Y) beats by $99.8M. Expects Q2 revenue of $590M and EPS of $0.05 vs. consensus of $605.3M and $0.05. Expects 2013 revenue of $4.25B and EPS of $0.80, below consensus of $4.26B and $0.85. Shares -6.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM

    Solazyme (SZYM): Q1 EPS of -$0.35 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $6.7M misses by $1.82M. Shares...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 in-line. Revenue of $601.4M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $12.5M....

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 in-line. Revenue of $601.4M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $12.5M. Expects Q2 revenue of $575M-$625M vs. $616.1M consensus. Expects Q2 operating income of $20M-$40M, reaffirms 2013 GAAP operating income guidance of $100M+. Shares +12.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • RAX

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX): Q1 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $362.2M (+20% Y/Y) misses by $5M....

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX): Q1 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $362.2M (+20% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Adjusted free cash flow of -$1M. Shares -3.8% AH. CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +1.6%) moves up after posting a better than expected Q1. Zacks upgraded...

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +1.6%) moves up after posting a better than expected Q1. Zacks upgraded the shares to Outperform from Neutral on the back of the report with a price target of $2.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -2.6%) says Q1 production of 6.4K boe/day did not meet expectations due to...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -2.6%) says Q1 production of 6.4K boe/day did not meet expectations due to delays in Utica caused by fixable midstream issues and those delays are now behind it, and plans to drill 55-60 gross wells this year vs. its prior expectation of 50 wells. Estimates Q2 production at 8.5K-9K boe/day. (Q1 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. (WMB -3.5%) is among the weakest stocks in the S&P 500 after reporting a big...

    Williams Cos. (WMB -3.5%) is among the weakest stocks in the S&P 500 after reporting a big Q1 profit drop and lowering its 2013 EPS outlook on weaker margins. In today's conference call, CEO Alan Armstrong projected dividends to grow 20%/year through 2015 despite low natural gas liquids prices, and said the needs for North American energy infrastructure would present opportunities for WMB and WPZ.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • HUM

    Shares of Humana (HUM +2.2%) gain today after the company says it plans to add approximately 500...

    Shares of Humana (HUM +2.2%) gain today after the company says it plans to add approximately 500 Telesales Specialists and leadership jobs nationally to its full-time Direct Marketing Services Telesales workforce, to meet demand for the upcoming annual Medicare open enrollment period.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • LOPE

    More on Grand Canyon Education (LOPE +14.2%): Shares extend earlier gains as investors like the...

    More on Grand Canyon Education (LOPE +14.2%): Shares extend earlier gains as investors like the 44.6% increase in ground enrollment and the 300bps Y/Y margin expansion. LOPE's outlook is ahead of the Street as the for-profit sees Q2 and FY13 EPS of $0.39-$0.40 and $1.76-1.79 respectively against consensus of $0.39 and $1.72. On the CC, management says enrollments will grow 8-10% annually and mentions in the Q&A that any perceived tepidness in terms of its view on retention rates or revenue growth is due to an attempt to exercise "conservatism." (PR, transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +2.7%) planned acquisition of Plains Exploration (NYSE:PXP) likely will...

    Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +2.7%) planned acquisition of Plains Exploration (NYSE:PXP) likely will close in June despite objections, Morgan Stanley predicts as it maintains an Outperform rating on the shares. Long-term FCX shareholders should be rewarded with strong growth through 2015 and lower political uncertainty, the firm says, adding that copper inventories are starting to decline.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • GFI

    With gold bears running rampant, J.P. Morgan’s new forecast for gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) to...

    With gold bears running rampant, J.P. Morgan’s new forecast for gold (NYSEARCA:GLD) to finish strong and trade near $1,700 by year-end is noteworthy. Among miners likely to benefit, the firm's favorites include Gold Fields (GFI +1.6%), which is least exposed to South Africa, and Sibanye Gold (SBGL +9.8%), which has lots of South Africa exposure but warrants an upgrade to Outperform from Neutral after plunging 38% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 6 Comments
  • CCO

    Clear Channel Outdoor (CCO +4.7%) spikes higher after Canyon Partners' Mitch Julis mentions the...

    Clear Channel Outdoor (CCO +4.7%) spikes higher after Canyon Partners' Mitch Julis mentions the company at the Ira Sohn conference in a positive light. The bull thesis in a nutshell: Billboards lead to dividends.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • TRMD-OLD

    Shares in Danish tanker group Torm (TRMD-OLD +122%) are ripping today after blowing away Q1...

    Shares in Danish tanker group Torm (TRMD-OLD +122%) are ripping today after blowing away Q1 estimates, posting results that showed its first return to quarterly operating profits since 2011 and the best tanker freight rates in four years. The shipper, who was on the verge of bankruptcy until a restructuring and deal with creditors last year, said spot tanker rates on the various sized tankers were up between 20% - 30% or more versus the previous year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • HLF

    Sometimes it's better to be ignored. Such is the case for Herbalife (HLF +1.3%) today, as the...

    Sometimes it's better to be ignored. Such is the case for Herbalife (HLF +1.3%) today, as the stock ticks back near its high following Ackman's glaring lack of comment at Ira Sohn. The stock had initially opened higher on the report of Carl Icahn's increased stake, but drifted lower over the course of the day as investors squared off ahead of Ackman's presentation. On good reason for Ackman to keep mum; the stock has risen nearly 28% over just the past month.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 4 Comments
  • JKS

    The EU plans to impose anti-dumping tariffs averaging 47.6%, and going as high as 67.9%, on...

    The EU plans to impose anti-dumping tariffs averaging 47.6%, and going as high as 67.9%, on Chinese solar panel imports by June 6, a "commerce official" tells Bloomberg. Several Chinese solar names are seeing moderate declines - investors have already been pricing in the impact of tariffs. JKS -3.8%. TSL -3.1%. YGE -2.9%. LDK -1.6%. CSIQ -4%. European trade group EU ProSun estimated in September Chinese firms control 80% of the local market. Additional tariffs could arrive later this year thanks to a solar subsidy investigation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • JCP

    No news is good news as shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +7%) stay at elevated levels following Bill...

    No news is good news as shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +7%) stay at elevated levels following Bill Ackman's presentation at the Ira Sohn conference with nary a mention of the retailer. With George Soros an investor and two hedge funds rumored to be moving in, Ackman may figure he can share the heavy lifting on JCP.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • DCO

    Shares of Ducommun (DCO -7%) take another hit today after falling 27% on Tuesday in reaction to...

    Shares of Ducommun (DCO -7%) take another hit today after falling 27% on Tuesday in reaction to a Q1 miss and an triggering few downgrades on the back of it: Imperial Capital to In-Line, C.K. Cooper to Hold and Noble Financial to Hold. Yesterday's move was big on very heavy volume, and erased a big chunk of the 85% run the stock had made since early March.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • ESE

    Shares of ESCO Technologies (ESE -10%) get smacked today after the company reported a weak Q2...

    Shares of ESCO Technologies (ESE -10%) get smacked today after the company reported a weak Q2 yesterday, citing project delays as customer decisions are stretching out over a longer period. RFP evaluation processes and technology piloting activity are also running considerably longer than they have historically. The company also cut FY13 earnings guidance to $1.60 to $1.80 from $2.30 to $2.50. Analyst estimates were for $2.06. Additionally, Baird cuts its rating to Neutral and drops its price target to $37.00 from $45.00 on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • OME

    Omega Protein (OME +15.7%) soars after its earnings beat. Profit margins rose to 24.7% during...

    Omega Protein (OME +15.7%) soars after its earnings beat. Profit margins rose to 24.7% during Q1, up 420bps sequentially and 310bps Y/Y — this was the third straight quarter of consolidated gross margin expansion. Sales of OmegaActiv (concentrated fish oil) grew during the period, underscoring progress in the human nutrition segment, where revenues rose 32% sequentially. On the call, both the company and D.A. Davidson's Timothy Ramey mentioned OmegaActive's SupplySide Insight Award (with Swanson) as evidence of OME's opportunities going forward. (PR, transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -3.2%) and LinkedIn (LNKD -2%) are having a rough day after Doug Kass reports hearing...

    Yelp (YELP -3.2%) and LinkedIn (LNKD -2%) are having a rough day after Doug Kass reports hearing the companies will be among the names discussed as short ideas at the Sohn Investment Conference (attended by many top hedge funds). Yelp remains well above where it traded prior to last week's Q1 report and guidance hike.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • GOLD

    Today's dead-cat bounce in the mining sector looks like a reaction to the overwhelming...

    Today's dead-cat bounce in the mining sector looks like a reaction to the overwhelming bearishness, expressed in the options market yesterday by heavy buying of GDX puts. Volume in the gold miners ETF (GDX +4.8%) is only about average so far, indicating mere short-covering and no stampede back into gold stocks, Randall Forsyth writes. ABX +7.6%, GG +4.5%, NEM +4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 5 Comments
  • LOW

    Lowe's (LOW +3.4%) gets a lift from ISI Group on the firm's view that margins could go from 7%...

    Lowe's (LOW +3.4%) gets a lift from ISI Group on the firm's view that margins could go from 7% to 10% as productivity improves. A normalization in sales would also allow the retailer to support share price with new buybacks and dividend hikes. Shares of Lowe's are rated a Buy by ISI, although it still sees Home Depot (HD +0.2%) as the more attractive stock in the home improvement space.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceutical (ASTX -4.4%) succumbs to profit-taking for a second day on heavy volume,...

    Astex Pharmaceutical (ASTX -4.4%) succumbs to profit-taking for a second day on heavy volume, with no real catalyst to explain the move but some small sales reported by its CEO and one of its directors over the past couple days. The sales really aren't too surprising when you take into consideration that the stock has been on a tear since late last year, rising over 225% just since November.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • TWTC

    TW Telecom (TWTC +4.5%) jumps as Corvex's Keith Meister (an Icahn protege) tells Ira Sohn he'll...

    TW Telecom (TWTC +4.5%) jumps as Corvex's Keith Meister (an Icahn protege) tells Ira Sohn he'll be issuing a 13D today disclosing more than a 6% stake in the company. He sees the firm as an acquisition target, possibly by Level 3 (LVLT +5.6%) which is also rising as Meister ticks off the positive developments with respect to its balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • AXLL

    Shares of Axiall (AXLL -16.2%) plummet after earnings miss estimates by a wide margin. The...

    Shares of Axiall (AXLL -16.2%) plummet after earnings miss estimates by a wide margin. The acquisition of PPG's chlorine assets was largely responsible for an $88.6M increase in adjusted EBITDA from Q1 2012 in the Chlorovinyls segment (which accounts for most of the firm's sales), but relatively high ethylene costs and lower resin sales prices conspired to offset the gains. Meanwhile, net sales decreased in both the Building Products and Aromatics segments. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors (TWO +6.1%) continues sharply higher post-earnings, with management noting (CC...

    Two Harbors (TWO +6.1%) continues sharply higher post-earnings, with management noting (CC transcript) (presentation) this month's acquisition of a mortgage servicing outfit gives the company entry into the lucrative MSR business, but with little potential legal liability. The purchased company - Matrix FIn'l Services - has just 10 employees and hasn't originated loans in "many, many years ... a very clean acquisition."
